bibl.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to William F. Wharton, September 12, 1892
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No. 15. Consulate-General, U. S. A., Monrovia, Liberia, September 12, 1892
Mr. William D. McCoy, to the Department of State.
Remittance ($5.00) to the New York Herald, for subscription.
Inclosure-- 1. Letter containing remittance ($5.00) to the New York Herald.
No. 15. Consulate-General, U. S. A., Monrovia, Liberia, September 12, 1892.
Honorable William F. Wharton, Assistant Secretary of State, WASHINGTON, D. C.
Sir: Inclosed please find letter containing a remittance ($5.00) to the New York Herald, for subscription.

A bill was sent to me but as it was not properly receipted I have requested that another one be sent to you, to be kept until I submit my Report in the Quarter, that it may be included in the contingent expenses for this Quarter.
As I have three Daily papers on my personal list I have requested that the Herald be discontinued that I may have the Weekly Tribune and London Times (Weekly) instead.
